definition: to put sb on an intravenous drip
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from

point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items

sentences.english: The patient is put on a drip after her operation.
sentences.chinese: 那個病人動過手術後就打點滴。

sentences.english: I was on a drop all the time except when I was sleeping.
sentences.chinese: 除了睡覺的時間外，我一直都在打點滴。

sentences.english: The accident victim was hooked up to a drip administering intravenous fluids.
sentences.chinese: 打點滴，輸液，靜脈輸液治療法。

sentences.english: Why do not you listen to the arrangements for doctors to drips, ah, ah joke.
sentences.chinese: 你爲什麼不聽醫生的安排去打點滴啊，開玩笑啊。

sentences.english: When I was put on a drip, he told me interesting stories to make me happy.
sentences.chinese: 我打點滴的時候，他給我講有趣的故事讓我高興。

definition: to ignore/to brush off/to dismiss/to pay no attention to
body palpation (diagnostic method in TCM)/tactile examination
lit. to give medicine to a dead horse (idiom)/fig. to keep trying everything in a desperate situation
pinyin: si3 ma3 dang4 huo2 ma3 yi1

definition: to desensitize/to remove an allergic susceptibility
to go around in circles/to make a detour/(fig.) to beat about the bush
